intro: Ranunculus acris f. pumilus, commonly known as the dwarf meadow buttercup, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It features small, bright yellow flowers with five petals, often surrounded by a ring of sepals that resemble additional petals. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few centimeters, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are deeply lobed. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to gardens and natural ecosystems.
